unknown: You Learn More From Failure Than From Success. Don’t Let It Stop You. Failure Builds Character.
Vince Lombardi: It’s Not Whether You Get Knocked Down, It’s Whether You Get Up.
Steve Jobs: If You Are Working On Something That You Really Care About, You Don’t Have To Be Pushed. The Vision Pulls You.
Rob Siltanen: People Who Are Crazy Enough To Think They Can Change The World, Are The Ones Who Do.
Og Mandino: Failure Will Never Overtake Me If My Determination To Succeed Is Strong Enough.
Mohnish Pabrai: Entrepreneurs Are Great At Dealing With Uncertainty And Also Very Good At Minimizing Risk. That’s The Classic Entrepreneur.
Maya Angelou: We May Encounter Many Defeats But We Must Not Be Defeated.
Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe: Knowing Is Not Enough; We Must Apply. Wishing Is Not Enough; We Must Do.
Dr. Henry Link: We Generate Fears While We Sit. We Overcome Them By Action.
Henry Ford: Whether You Think You Can Or Think You Can’t, You’re Right.
Hasidic Proverb: The Man Who Has Confidence In Himself Gains The Confidence Of Others.
Franklin D. Roosevelt: The Only Limit To Our Realization Of Tomorrow Will Be Our Doubts Of Today.
Don Zimmer: What You Lack In Talent Can Be Made Up With Desire, Hustle And Giving 110% All The Time.
Theodore Roosevelt: Do What You Can With All You Have, Wherever You Are.
Brian Tracy: Develop An ‘Attitude Of Gratitude’. Say Thank You To Everyone You Meet For Everything They Do For You.
Confucius: To See What Is Right And Not Do It Is A Lack Of Courage.
Brian Tracy: Reading Is To The Mind, As Exercise Is To The Body.
Jack Canfield: For Every Reason It’s Not Possible, There Are Hundreds Of People Who Have Faced The Same Circumstances And Succeeded.
John Wooden: Things Work Out Best For Those Who Make The Best Of How Things Work Out.
Michael Phelps: I Think Goals Should Never Be Easy, They Should Force You To Work, Even If They Are Uncomfortable At The Time.
Michelle Obama: One Of The Lessons That I Grew Up With Was To Always Stay True To Yourself And Never Let What Somebody Else Says Distract You From Your Goals.
Steve Jobs: The Only Way To Do Great Work Is To Love What You Do. If You Haven’t Found It Yet, Keep Looking. Don’t Settle.
Zig Ziglar: You Don’t Have To Be Great To Start, But You Have To Start To Be Great.
Brian Tracy: A Clear Vision, Backed By Definite Plans, Gives You A Tremendous Feeling Of Confidence And Personal Power.
There Are No Limits To What You Can Accomplish, Except The Limits You Place On Your Own Thinking.
Integrity Is The Most Valuable And Respected Quality Of Leadership. Always Keep Your Word.
Gail Devers: Keep your dreams alive. Understand to achieve anything requires faith and belief in yourself, vision, hard work, determination, and dedication. Remember all things are possible for those who believe.
Dwayne Johnson: Success isn't always about greatness. It's about consistency. Consistent hard work leads to success. Greatness will come.
Stephen King: Talent is cheaper than table salt. What separates the talented individual from the successful one is a lot of hard work.
